Package Collecto

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • Collecto.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    This class contains the client used by users who want to connect to a server and play a game. Upon running this class it will prompt the user for an IP and a port to connect to a server, and it will then provide further functionality to communicate with the server, play the game, let an AI play the game, provide hints, and disconnect. It also uses the TUI class to print states of the game for the user to see. It stores a socket for communication with a sever, a game to play, logs to print if you encounter errors, the name by which the player is logged in to a sever and a ClientController to receive user input.
    See Also:
    Server, TUI, Game, ClientController

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client​(java.net.Socket socket)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes communication with server and input from the user by creating a new BufferedReader, BufferedWriter, and ClientController, and using the socket given in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        socket - socket connected to a server
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the socket fails

    • Method Detail

      • handleCommandIn

        public void handleCommandIn​(java.lang.String serverInput)
        Handles commands sent by a connected server. Splits the serverInput on the delimiter as defined in Global.DELIMITER and assumes the first word is the command sent by the server, and the rest of the serverInput is information on what to do with that command. Based on the command this method calls other methods in this class to carry out the functionality. If the command is not recognized, the client prints an error by default stating it did not understand what command the server sent.
        Parameters:
        serverInput - String input from the server

      • handleMove

        protected void handleMove​(java.lang.String[] params)
        Handles a move input from the user using this client. Checks whether the move is valid and parses it to a push format according to the protocol, meaning an integer between 0 and 27. Also checks if a double move is made, whether a single move could still be made, and if so notifies the user. Ultimately sends the move to the server if it passes all clientside checks.
        Parameters:
        params - user input

      • chooseAI

        protected void chooseAI​(java.lang.String[] answer)
        Checks the answers of the user to the question of whether they want to play with an AI or not. If not, the AI choosing sequence is ended and the sleeping server input thread is woken up. Otherwise, the user is asked to choose the level of the AI, and continues to the chooseDifficulty(String[]) method.
        Parameters:
        answer - user input

      • chooseDifficulty

        protected void chooseDifficulty​(java.lang.String[] answer)
        Handles user input for AI difficulty level specification. Will not initialise AI until answer will be either 1 or 2. When a correct answer is chosen, ends the AI choosing sequence and wakes up the sleeping server input thread.
        Parameters:
        answer - array of split user answer

      • hint

        protected void hint()
        Generates a hint using ComputerPlayer for the current game board and displays it. Uses the beginner AI to show to the user the first possible single move, or the first possible double move if no single move is possible.
        See Also:
        ComputerPlayer.makeBeginnerMove(GridBoard)

      • sendMessage

        protected void sendMessage​(java.lang.String message)
        Sends a String message to a connected server. Adds a log of every outgoing message.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be sent to the server

      • printBoard

        protected void printBoard()
        Prints the board of a current game for the user to see.

      • printLogs

        protected void printLogs()
        Prints all recorded logs for the user to see. This includes incoming and outgoing messages, internal errors, errors sent by the server, and other noteworthy events.

      • disconnect

        protected void disconnect()
        Disconnects from a server. Closes the socket, reader and writer, and clears the socket and the game of this client, and then gracefully terminates the program.

      • printHelp

        protected void printHelp()
        Prints a help menu for the user to read.

      • inGame

        protected boolean inGame()
        Checks to see if the client is currently playing a game.
        Returns:
        true if game != null, false if game == null

      • run

        public void run()
        Listens to the server. This command overrides the run() method from the Runnable interface, and is triggered in the main method when the server input thread is started. It then continuously listens to the server input until this client or the server disconnects. In case of the server disconnecting, it triggers the disconnect() method to terminate this client. It also adds a log for every incoming message.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
